sections.name: Werendegar
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Chaotic
traits.text: Chaotic effects often manipulate energy from chaos-aligned Outer Planes and are anathema to lawful divine servants or divine servants of lawful deities. A creature with this trait is chaotic in alignment.

traits.name: Fey
traits.text: Creatures of the First World are called the fey.

interaction_abilities.name: Hungersense
interaction_abilities.text: Hungersense allows the gimmerling to sense creatures that require food to live.

gear.name: +3 major striking greater shock wounding rapier

automatic_abilities.name: Thorny Aura
automatic_abilities.text: aura, primal, transmutation) 15 feet. Thorny roots and barbed vines writhe and twist in the aura, creating difficult hazardous terrain that inflicts 4d6 piercing damage whenever a non-flying creature moves within the aura.

reactive_abilities.name: Trip Up
reactive_abilities.trigger: A creature critically fails a melee attack to hit the gimmerling or moves into a space within the gimmerling's treacherous aura.
reactive_abilities.effect: The triggering creature must attempt a DC 44 Reflex save.
reactive_abilities.success: The target is flat-footed until the start of its next turn.
reactive_abilities.failure: The target takes 2d10 bludgeoning damage and is flat-footed until the start of its next turn.
reactive_abilities.critical_failure: As failure, and the target is knocked prone.

traits.name: Deadly
traits.text: On a critical hit, the weapon adds a weapon damage die of the listed size. Roll this after doubling the weapon's damage. This increases to two dice if the weapon has a _greater striking rune_ and three dice if the weapon has a _major striking rune_. For instance, a rapier with a _greater striking rune_ deals 2d8 extra piercing damage on a critical hit. An ability that changes the size of the weapon's normal damage dice doesn't change the size of its deadly die.

traits.name: Disarm
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Disarm with the Athletics skill even if you don't have a free hand. This uses the weapon's reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon's item bonus to attack rolls (if any) as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Disarm using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure. On a critical success, you still need a free hand if you want to take the item.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still use your Strength modifier when calculating damage.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still use your Strength modifier when calculating damage.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still use your Strength modifier when calculating damage.

ability.name: Change Shape

traits.name: Concentrate
traits.text: An action with this trait requires a degree of mental concentration and discipline.

traits.name: Polymorph
traits.text:
These effects transform the target into a new form. A target can't be under the effect of more than one polymorph effect at a time. If it comes under the effect of a second polymorph effect, the second polymorph effect attempts to counteract the first. If it succeeds, it takes effect, and if it fails, the spell has no effect on that target. Any Strikes specifically granted by a polymorph effect are magical. Unless otherwise stated, polymorph spells don't allow the target to take on the appearance of a specific individual creature, but rather just a generic creature of a general type or ancestry.  
  
 If you take on a battle form with a polymorph spell, the special statistics can be adjusted only by circumstance bonuses, status bonuses, and penalties. Unless otherwise noted, the battle form prevents you from casting spells, speaking, and using most manipulate actions that require hands. (If there's doubt about whether you can use an action, the GM decides.) Your gear is absorbed into you; the constant abilities of your gear still function, but you can't activate any items.

traits.name: Primal
traits.text: This magic comes from the primal tradition, connecting to the natural world and instinct. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Transmutation
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the transmutation school of magic, typically changing something’s form.

ability.text: The gimmerling changes into its natural form or that of any humanoid. In humanoid form, it loses its treacherous aura, and its equipment appears to be trinkets or toys. As a humanoid that lacks claws or fangs, it loses the matching Strike. If it loses its claw Strike, it gains a fist Strike that is identical except that it deals bludgeoning damage.

ability.name: Disarm
ability.effect: The gimmerling knocks a held or carried weapon to the ground in the target's space.
ability.text: The gimmerling's last action was a success with a Strike that has Disarm in its damage entry.

ability.name: Sneak Attack
ability.text: Werendegar deals 4d6 extra precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

ability.name: Trickster's Step
ability.text: The gimmerling ignores difficult terrain and doesn't trigger traps with its movement. Werendegar also avoids hazardous terrain.
